entries: The Guild Wars franchise is the flagship franchise of the Washington state based development studio ArenaNet.
The fifth entry into it's now 20 year old story is Guild Wars 2.
This book aims to capture the story and the feelings of this beloved game, and bring them to the gaming table with the help of the Dungeons & Dragons 5 edition rule set.
All credit goes to the amazing people at ArenaNet and NCSoft, who have given us players such magical adventures.

classFeature.name: Subclass Choice
entries: You gain a subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at levels 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, and 20.

classFeature.name: Effervescent Shoals
entries: Channeling the Element of Water to heal and mend your learned some new skills. To start, you learn one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Healing Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Healing Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Healing Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} at a time, choosing from your learned {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}. You can change which healing skill you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Channeling
entries: You learned to channel your Elemental magic through specific weapons, unleashing their potential. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Elementalist level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, in which hand you wield it, which attunement your are in, and if qualify for it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Fire Attunement|GW2}, {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Water Attunement|GW2}, {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Air Attunement|GW2}, and {@table Elementalist Weapon Skills: Earth Attunement|GW2} tables.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.

Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great focus, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time. You can change which weapon you are channeling during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can channel additional weapons. At level 5 you can channel a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand.

classFeature.name: Primordial Influence
entries: You have a versatile Omni-Tool that can adapt to a variety of situations. This tool takes the form of a wrench, screwdriver, or other basic tool. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into one of the following: {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Jeweler's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Woodcarver's Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have proficiency with it when you use it.
You can only have one Omni-Tool at a time. If you try to create a new one while you still have your current one, the current one is destroyed.
If you loose or destroy your Omni-Tool, you can create a new one during a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Elemental Prowess
entries: Your Elementalisting prowess has granted you access to {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} that enhance your abilities. To start, you gain access to the Specialization of your subclass and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

The number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Traits column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} on your list matches the number on the table. You can only learn {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the Specializations you have access to and must follow the prerequisites for each {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

Each Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} has three options to choose from. When you learn a Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}, you learn all three options, but you can only prepare one option at a time. You can change which option you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Specialization
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Anchor Energy
entries: Your Elementalisting prowess has led to you inventing new ways to succeed. To start, you learn five {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Utility Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Utility Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Utility Skills|GW2} until the number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Elemental Expertise
entries: Your expertise in Elementalisting has granted you access to a second Specialization. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from either of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Primordial Mastery
entries: Your Omni-Tool has been modified for rapid repairs. While holding your Omni-Tool, you can use your {@variantrule bonus action|XPHB} to cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Channeled Energy
entries: Your extensive training has made you exceptionally prepared for any situation. You can now prepare and use two {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Rapid Channeling
entries: You have learned to channel your Elementalisting prowess through more weapons. You can designate a second set of weapons you can enhance, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).

classFeature.name: Energy Apotheosis
entries: You can now prepare and use three {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Elementalist level 16.

classFeature.name: Elemental Perfection
entries: You perfected your Elementalisting. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Elementalist Traits|GW2} table, that you do not already have access to. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from any of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Primordial Influence
entries: Your Omni-Tool has evolved into an Omega-Tool, capable of transforming into any tool you might need. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into any set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have expertise with it when you use it.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Elemental Cataclysm
entries: You have mastered the use of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} that provide powerful effects. To start, you learn one {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Elementalist Elite Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} you know increases as you gain Elementalist levels, as shown in the Elite Skills Known column of the Elementalist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}, for which you qualify, from the Elementalist {@table Elementalist Elite Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.
You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Primordial Ascension
entries: Your advanced Elementalisting allows you to reshape the world around you. While holding your Omega-Tool, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the {@spell Fabricate|XPHB} spell.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Elementalist subclass.

classFeature.name: Subclass Choice
entries: You gain a subclass of your choice. Your choice grants you features at levels 1, 3, 5, 10, 15, and 20.

classFeature.name: Restorative Ingenuity
entries: You have learned unique ways to heal wounds and mend injuries. To start, you learn one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Healing Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Healing Skills Known column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Healing Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skill} at a time, choosing from your learned {@variantrule Healing Skill|GW2|Healing Skills}. You can change which healing skill you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Mechanized Mayhem
entries: Your Engineer training has given you access to unique ways to enhance your weapons. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Engineer level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, in which hand you wield it, and if qualify for it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the {@table Engineer Weapon Skills|GW2} table.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Intelligence modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.

Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great focus, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time. You can change which weapon you are using during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.
When you reach certain levels in this class, you can enhance additional weapons. At level 5 you can enhance a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand.

classFeature.name: Omni-Tool
entries: You have a versatile Omni-Tool that can adapt to a variety of situations. This tool takes the form of a wrench, screwdriver, or other basic tool. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into one of the following: {@item Carpenter's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Jeweler's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Mason's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Woodcarver's Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have proficiency with it when you use it.
You can only have one Omni-Tool at a time. If you try to create a new one while you still have your current one, the current one is destroyed.
If you loose or destroy your Omni-Tool, you can create a new one during a {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Engineering Prowess
entries: Your Engineering prowess has granted you access to {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} that enhance your abilities. To start, you gain access to the Specialization of your subclass and learn its Minor Adept {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

The number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Traits column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} on your list matches the number on the table. You can only learn {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from the Specializations you have access to and must follow the prerequisites for each {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}.

Each Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait} has three options to choose from. When you learn a Major {@variantrule traits|GW2|trait}, you learn all three options, but you can only prepare one option at a time. You can change which option you have prepared during a {@variantrule short rest|XPHB|short} or {@variantrule long rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Specialization
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: A Skill for every Job
entries: Your engineering prowess has led to you inventing new ways to succeed. To start, you learn five {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Utility Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Utility Skills Known column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills}, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Utility Skills|GW2} until the number of {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.

You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Engineering Expertise
entries: Your expertise in engineering has granted you access to a second Specialization. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from either of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Quick-Fix Omni-Tool
entries: Your Omni-Tool has been modified for rapid repairs. While holding your Omni-Tool, you can use your {@variantrule bonus action|XPHB} to cast the {@spell Mending|XPHB} spell.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Always Prepared
entries: Your extensive training has made you exceptionally prepared for any situation. You can now prepare and use two {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Mechanized Multiplicity
entries: You have learned to channel your engineering prowess through more weapons. You can designate a second set of weapons you can enhance, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).

classFeature.name: Eternally Prepared
entries: You can now prepare and use three {@variantrule Utility Skill|GW2|Utility Skills} at a time.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Engineer level 16.

classFeature.name: Engineering Perfection
entries: You perfected your engineering. Choose a Specialization of your choice for which you qualify from the {@table Engineer Traits|GW2} table, that you do not already have access to. When learning new {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits}, you can choose {@variantrule traits|GW2|traits} from any of your Specializations.

classFeature.name: Omega-Tool
entries: Your Omni-Tool has evolved into an Omega-Tool, capable of transforming into any tool you might need. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the tool and transform it into any set of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} or {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}. Whatever form the tool takes, you have expertise with it when you use it.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Perfected Utility
entries: You have mastered the use of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} that provide powerful effects. To start, you learn one {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skill} of your choice, for which you qualify, from the {@table Engineer Elite Skills|GW2} table. The number of {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|Elite Skills} you know increases as you gain Engineer levels, as shown in the Elite Skills Known column of the Engineer Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills}, for which you qualify, from the Engineer {@table Engineer Elite Skills|GW2} table until the number of {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skills} on your list matches the number on the table.
You can only prepare and use one {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} at a time. You can change which {@variantrule Elite Skill|GW2|Elite Skill} you have prepared during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Advanced Engineering
entries: Your advanced engineering allows you to reshape the world around you. While holding your Omega-Tool, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to cast the {@spell Fabricate|XPHB} spell.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Engineer subclass.

classFeature.name: Weapon Skills
entries: Your Necromancer training has given you access to unqiue ways to channel necromantic energy through your weapons. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Necromancer level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, and in which hand you wield it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the Weapon Skills table.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Strength or Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Wisdom modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.
Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great focus, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time.

When you reach certain levels in this class, you can channel your necromantic energy through additional weapons. At level 5 you can channel through a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand. At level 10, you can designate a second set of weapons you can channel through, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).
You can change which weapon you are using to channel your necromantic energy to during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Death Shroud
entries: You have learned to tap into the power of death itself. During your turn, you can enter or exit Death Shroud (no {@variantrule Action|XPHB} required) if you have at least 10% life force. Once you exit Death Shroud, you cannot enter it again until the recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).
{@b Life Force.} Your life force is a pool of energy that fuels your necromantic abilities. Your maximum life force is equal to 69% of your maximum hit points.

{@b Gaining Life Force.} When you finish a short rest, you regain life force up to 50% of your maximum life force. When you finish a long rest, you regain life force up to 100% of your maximum life force. While not in Death Shroud, whenever a creature within 120 feet of you dies, you regain life force equal to 10% of your maximum life force.
While in Death Shroud, you gain the following effects:

items: {@b Hit Points.} When you take damage, you lose life force instead of hit points. If you have no life force remaining, you leave Death Shroud and any remaining damage is dealt to your hit points as normal.
{@b Damage Resistance.} You gain resistance to all damage.
{@b Life Force Drain.} At the start of each of your turns, you lose life force equal to 15% of your maximum life force (minimum 1).
{@b Hit Point Regeneration.} You cannot regain hit points except through {@variantrule Life Steal|GW2}.

{@b Profession Skills.} You gain access to a special set of {@variantrule profession skill|GW2|profession skills} (see below) at certain levels. You cannot cast spells, use {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon-}, {@variantrule healing skill|GW2|healing-}, {@variantrule utility skill|GW2|utility-} or {@variantrule elite skill|GW2|elite-}{@variantrule skill|GW2|skills}, make weapon attacks or make unarmed attacks.

classFeature.name: Minor Adept
entries: You Necromancer training has granted you access to minor adept skills that enhance your necromantic abilities. Choose one trait line from the Necromancer Traits table below. You gain the level 2 minor adept trait from that trait line. You also gain access to the level 5 major adept trait, level 9 minor master trait, level 11 major master trait, level 15 minor grandmaster trait, and level 18 major grandmaster trait from that trait line as you reach the appropriate levels in this class. When you gain a second trait line at level 9, you learn the level 2 minor adept trait from that trait line as well.

classFeature.name: Healing Skills
entries: You have learned to harness necromantic energy to heal wounds and mend injuries. You learn one healing skill based on the trait lines you chose at levels 2 and 9 as shown in the Healing Skills table below.
You can only prepare and use one healing skill at a time. You can change which healing skill you have learned during a short or long rest.

entries.caption: Necromancer Healing Skills
rows: {@optfeature Summon Blood Fiend|GW2} -> {@optfeature Taste of Death|GW2}

classFeature.name: Necromancer Subclass
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a Necromancer subclass that reflects your approach to necromantic magic. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 13th, 17th, and 20th levels.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Major Adept
entries: You have advanced your necromantic training further, gaining access to major adept skills that enhance your necromantic abilities. You learn one of three major adept traits of your choice from the Necromancer trait list based on the trait line you chose at level 2. When you gain a second trait line at level 9, you can choose a major adept trait from that trait line as well. You can change which traits you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Utility Skills
entries: Having mastered the basics of necromantic magic, you gain access to utility skills that provide various benefits. You learn one utility skill of your choice based on the trait line you chose at level 2 as shown in the Utility Skills table below.

Later you gain access to additional utility skills as you gain levels in this class. You can only prepare and use three utility skills at a time. You can change which utility skills you have learned during a short or long rest.

entries.caption: Necromancer Utility Skills
rows: {@optfeature Well of Corruption|GW2} or {@optfeature Well of Darkness|GW2} or {@optfeature Well of Power|GW2} or {@optfeature Well of Suffering|GW2}
{@optfeature Blood Is Power|GW2} or {@optfeature Corrosive Poison Cloud|GW2} or {@optfeature Corrupt Boon|GW2} or {@optfeature Epidemic|GW2}

{@optfeature Summon Bone Fiend|GW2} -> {@optfeature Rigor Mortis|GW2} or {@optfeature Summon Bone Minions|GW2} -> {@optfeature Putrid Explosion|GW2} or {@optfeature Summon Flesh Wurm|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Traversal|GW2} or {@optfeature Summon Shadow Fiend|GW2} -> {@optfeature Haunt|GW2}
{@optfeature Spectral Armor|GW2} or {@optfeature Spectral Grasp|GW2} or {@optfeature Spectral Walk|GW2} -> {@optfeature Spectral Recall|GW2} or {@optfeature Spectral Ring|GW2}
{@optfeature Plague Signet|GW2} or {@optfeature Signet of Spite|GW2} or {@optfeature Signet of Undeath|GW2} or {@optfeature Signet of the Locust|GW2}

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer levels 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Minor Master
entries: Mastering necromancy has granted you access to two minor master traits. You learn the minor master trait associated with the trait line you chose at level 2.
Additionally, choose a second trait line from the Necromancer trait list and learn the level 2 minor adept trait, a level 5 major adept trait and the level 9 minor master trait from that trait line.

classFeature.name: Utility Skills
entries: You gain access to one additional utility skill based on the trait lines you chose at level 2 and 9 as shown in the Necromancer Utility Skills table above.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Major Master
entries: Your mastery of necromancy has granted you access to major adept skills that enhance your necromantic abilities. You learn one of three major master traits of your choice from the Necromancer trait list for each of the trait lines you chose at level 2 and 9. You can change which traits you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify. You gain this feature again at Necromancer level 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 13th level, you gain a feature granted by your Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Minor Grandmaster
entries: You are a grandmaster Necromancer, giving you access to two minor grandmaster traits. You learn the minor grandmaster traits associated with the trait lines you chose at level 2 and 9.

classFeature.name: Utility Skills
entries: You gain access to one additional utility skill based on the trait lines you chose at level 2 and 9 as shown in the Necromancer Utility Skills table above.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Major Grandmaster
entries: You have reached the pinnacle of necromantic mastery, granting you access to major grandmaster traits that enhance your necromantic abilities. You learn one of three major grandmaster traits of your choice from the Necromancer trait list for each of the trait lines you chose at level 2, and 9. You can change which traits you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Elite Skills
entries: You have mastered the use of elite skills that provide powerful effects. You learn one elite skill of your choice based on the trait line you chose at level 2 and 9 as shown in the Elite Skills table below.
You can only prepare and use one elite skill at a time. You can change which elite skill you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Necromancer subclass.

classFeature.name: Weapon Skills
entries: Your Warrior training has given you access to unqiue ways to use your weapons. Depending on the weapon you wield, your Warrior level, if you have proficiency with that weapon, and in which hand you wield it, you gain access to different {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2|weapon skills} as shown in the Weapon Skills table.

Whenever you attack with one of the weapons as part of a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2}, you can use your Strength modifier for the attack and damage rolls instead of using Dexterity. If a {@variantrule weapon skill|GW2} requires a saving throw, the DC equals to 8 plus your Strength modifier and proficiency bonus plus any attack bonuses the weapon has.
Using the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} ascociated with your weapon requires great training, you can only gain access to the {@variantrule skill|GW2|skills} for one weapon at a time.

When you reach certain levels in this class, you can train additional weapons. At level 5 you can train a second weapon, if that weapon is wielded in your off hand. At level 10, you can designate a second set of weapons you trained, the second set either consists of one weapon wielded in your main hand and one in your off hand, or one two-handed weapon. Once during your turn, you can swap between them (no {@variantrule action|XPHB} required). Once you swamp weapons, you cannot switch again until recharged ({@chance 55|10+}).
You can change which weapon you are trained in during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Adrenaline
entries: In the heat of battle, you can tap into your adrenaline to push your body beyond its normal limits. Each time you hit with a weapon attack, you gain 1 strike of adrenaline, up to a maximum of 30 strikes. Adrenaline strikes last until combat ends or they are used and cannot be generated outside of combat.

Adrenaline can be spent to fuel powerful combat maneuvers call burst {@variantrule Profession Skill|GW2|skills}, that are unique to each weapon. When you expend adrenaline to use a burst {@variantrule Profession Skill|GW2|skills}, you must spend at leat 10 strikes of adrenaline and you always expend all strikes. The effect of the burst {@variantrule Profession Skill|GW2|skills} depends on the number of strikes you expend as shown in the Burst Profession Skills table below.

classFeature.name: Minor Adept
entries: You Warrior training has granted you access to minor adept skills that enhance your martial abilities. Choose one trait line from the Warrior Traits table below. You gain the level 2 minor adept trait from that trait line. You also gain access to the level 5 major adept trait, level 9 minor master trait, level 11 major master trait, level 15 minor grandmaster trait, and level 18 major grandmaster trait from that trait line as you reach the appropriate levels in this class. When you gain a second trait line at level 9, you learn the level 2 minor adept trait from that trait line as well.

classFeature.name: Healing Skills
entries: You can quickly patch up battlefield injuries. You learn one healing skill based on the trait lines you chose at levels 2 and 9 as shown in the Healing Skills table below.
You can only prepare and use one healing skill at a time. You can change which healing skill you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Warrior Subclass
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a Warrior subclass that reflects your approach to martial combat. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 6th, 10th, 13th, 17th, and 20th levels.

You learn one of three major adept traits of your choice from the Warrior trait list based on the trait line you chose at level 2. When you gain a second trait line at level 9, you can choose a major adept trait from that trait line as well. You can change which traits you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Utility Skills
entries: Having mastered the basics of martial combat, you gain access to utility skills that provide various benefits. You learn one utility skill of your choice based on the trait line you chose at level 2 as shown in the Utility Skills table below.

Later you gain access to additional utility skills as you gain levels in this class. You can only prepare and use three utility skills at a time. You can change which utility skills you have learned during a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature

entries.name: Elementalist
entries: Elementalists are multifaceted spellcasters who channel elemental forces, making fire, air, earth, and water do their bidding. What they lack in physical toughness, they make up for in versatility and the ability to inflict massive damage.

entries.name: Necromancer
entries: Practitioners of the dark arts, necromancers summon minions, wield the power of ritual, and heal themselves with blood magic. Necromancers feed on life force, which they can leverage offensively or use to delay their own demise.

optionalfeature.name: Lava Font

prerequisite.other: Level 3+ Elementalist, Two Handed Staff & Attuned to Fire.

entries: {@b Description:} Make lava erupt from the target area.

{@b Effect:} Choose a point that you can see within range. For the duration, you create a 18-foot-radius Sphere centered on that point. Each creature in that Sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage and starts {@variantrule Burning|GW2} for 1 round taking {@damage 1d6} damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage but suffers no other effects. A creature also makes this save if it enters the Sphere or ends its turn there.
{@b Scaling:} The damage increases each by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 3d6} & {@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 4d6} & {@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 5d6} & {@damage 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: Rifle Burst
entries: {@b Description:} Deliver a quick burst of fire that pierces targets, followed by an explosive grenade.

optionalfeature.name: Rifle Burst Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Fire an explosive grenade from your rifle.

optionalfeature.name: Blunderbuss
entries: {@b Description:} Fire several shards of shrapnel that inflict more damage the closer you are to foes. You and nearby allies gain might.

optionalfeature.name: Net Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Immobilize foes with a net shot.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharged Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a blast so strong that it launches your foe as the recoil frees you from any movement-impairing conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Jump Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Blast the ground, damaging nearby foes and leaping to your target.

optionalfeature.name: Fragmentation Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a shot that bleeds the impacted target and then shatters, dealing damage to nearby enemies.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Dart Volley
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a volley of darts that poison foes.

optionalfeature.name: Static Shot
entries: {@b Properties:} Bounces, Inflicts Blind, Inflicts Confusion
{@b Description:} Discharge a lightning shot that bounces between multiple foes, blinding and confusing them.

optionalfeature.name: Blowtorch
entries: {@b Description:} Unleash flames from your pistol to burn foes. Deals more damage the closer you are.

optionalfeature.name: Glue Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Coat the target area with a glue puddle that immobilizes foes on impact, then cripples foes that remain within.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Shield
entries: {@b Description:} Create a magnetic field that reflects projectiles and can be released to knock back foes.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Inversion

prerequisite.other: Requires Shield. Must follow Magnetic Shield activation.

entries: {@b Description:} Release the magnetic field to knock back nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Static Shield
entries: {@b Description:} Electrify your shield, preparing to throw it at foes. Stun nearby enemies that attack you while blocking.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Shield

prerequisite.other: Requires Shield. Must follow Static Shield activation.

entries: {@b Description:} Throw your charged shield. Dazes foes it hits on the way out and back.

optionalfeature.name: Homing Torpedo
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a shot that homes in on your foe and detonates an area around them.

optionalfeature.name: Scatter Mines
entries: {@b Description:} Fire out a spread of explosive mines at your enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Capture Line
entries: {@b Description:} Cast out a towline and drag your foe toward you.

optionalfeature.name: Timed Charge
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a timed charge at your target, damaging and burning nearby foes when it detonates.

optionalfeature.name: Net Wall
entries: {@b Description:} Launch a deployable net wall to immobilize foes caught within.

optionalfeature.name: Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Set an explosive that damages nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Fire Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Set an explosive that burns nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Galvanic Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Set an explosive that electrocutes nearby foes, dazing them.

optionalfeature.name: Magnetic Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Set a timed charge that pulls nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Big Ol' Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Set a timed charge with a big blast that knocks down nearby foes. This skill blast finishes twice.

optionalfeature.name: Mortar Shot
entries: {@b Description:} Launch an explosive round from your mortar, damaging foes in the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Gas Shell
entries: {@b Description:} Launch a mortar round that spreads poisonous gas in an area.

optionalfeature.name: Endothermic Shell
entries: {@b Description:} Launch a mortar round that chills foes in the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Flash Shell
entries: {@b Description:} Launch a phosphorous mortar round that burns brightly at impact point.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir Shell
entries: {@b Description:} Elixir. Launch a mortar round that heals allies in the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Tranquilizer Dart
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a dart that bleeds and weakens foes.

optionalfeature.name: Glob Shot
entries: {@b Properties:} Bouncing, Inflicts Cripple, Grants Swiftness, Immobilize
{@b Description:} Fire a bouncing glob that cripples foes and grants swiftness to you and your allies. The first enemy struck is immobilized.

optionalfeature.name: Fumigate
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Poison, Inflicts Vulnerability, Cures Conditions
{@b Description:} Spray a cone of elixir fumes, inflicting poison and vulnerability to foes and curing conditions on allies with every strike.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Elixir. Leap backward, spraying an acidic elixir on the ground that damages nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Super Elixir
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Heal, Grants Continuous Healing
{@b Description:} Elixir. Shoot an elixir orb, healing allies when it bursts and creating an area of continual healing.

optionalfeature.name: Super Elixir (Flip-over)
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Heal, Grants Continuous Healing
{@b Description:} Burst the orb, instantly healing your allies and creating an area of continual healing.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Jet
entries: {@b Description:} Spray fire in a cone pattern while moving, burning foes on the final attack. Deals 10% bonus damage to burning targets.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Blast
entries: {@b Description:} Fire a napalm ball that explodes on impact.

optionalfeature.name: Air Blast
entries: {@b Description:} Push back foes and projectiles with a hot-air blast, burning foes that are already on fire.

optionalfeature.name: Stoke the Flames
entries: {@b Description:} Overcharge your flamethrower with a fuel injection, releasing a burst of flames around you as you grant yourself boons.

optionalfeature.name: Napalm
entries: {@b Description:} Immobilize enemies in front of you with a cone of intense fire.

optionalfeature.name: Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Throw several grenades that explode.

optionalfeature.name: Shrapnel Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Throw grenades that explode in a hall of shrapnel, causing bleeding.

optionalfeature.name: Flash Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Throw grenades that explode in blinding flashes.

optionalfeature.name: Freeze Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Throw grenades that chill foes with frigid blasts.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Grenade
entries: {@b Description:} Throw several grenades that explode in poisonous blasts.

optionalfeature.name: Med Blaster
entries: {@b Description:} Restore health to allies with several pulses of healing energy. Heals more for each boon on the ally.

optionalfeature.name: Bandage Blast
entries: {@b Description:} Fire several bandages ahead of you to heal allies.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Field
entries: {@b Description:} Release purifying vapors to cleanse conditions from allies near you at each interval.

optionalfeature.name: Vital Burst
entries: {@b Description:} Unleash a cascade of concentrated healing vapors around you.

optionalfeature.name: Infusion Bomb
entries: {@b Description:} Throw a bomb that grants boons to nearby allies when it explodes.

optionalfeature.name: Smack
entries: {@b Description:} Smack your foe. Repair turrets.

optionalfeature.name: Whack

prerequisite.other: Requires Tool Kit. Must follow Smack.

entries: {@b Description:} Whack your foe. Repairs turrets.

optionalfeature.name: Thwack

prerequisite.other: Requires Tool Kit. Must follow Whack.

entries: {@b Description:} Thwack your foe. Repairs turrets.

optionalfeature.name: Box of Nails
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Bleeding, Inflicts Cripple, Immobilize

{@b Description:} Scatter nails that bleed and cripple foes. The first pulse of this skill will immobilize foes who are movement impaired or disabled. Disables include stun, daze, knockdown, pull, knockback, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Box of Piranhas
entries: {@b Properties:} Inflicts Bleeding, Inflicts Cripple, Immobilize, Underwater Skill

{@b Description:} Release piranhas that bleed and cripple foes. The first pulse of this skill will immobilize foes who are movement impaired or disabled. Disables include stun, daze, knockdown, pull, knockback, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Pry Bar
entries: {@b Description:} Confuse your foe by smacking them with a pry bar.

optionalfeature.name: Magnet
entries: {@b Description:} Pull your target to you.

optionalfeature.name: Necrotic Slash
entries: {@b Properties:} {@variantrule Chain|GW2|Chain:} {@optfeature Necrotic Slash|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Stab|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Bite|GW2}
{@b Effect:} Make two melee weapon attack against up to two creatures within reach each. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage.
{@b Scaling:} The damage increases by 1d4 when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d4}), 11 ({@damage 3d4}), and 17 ({@damage 4d4}).

optionalfeature.name: Necrotic Stab

prerequisite.other: Level 1+ Necromancer & Main Hand Dagger & {@optfeature Necrotic Slash|GW2} used this turn.

entries: {@b Properties:} {@variantrule Chain|GW2|Chain:} {@optfeature Necrotic Slash|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Stab|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Bite|GW2}
{@b Effect:} Make a melee weapon attack against up to two creatures within reach. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage. You gain 4% life force for each target hit.
{@b Scaling:} The damage increases by 1d4 when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d4}), 11 ({@damage 3d4}), and 17 ({@damage 4d4}).

optionalfeature.name: Necrotic Bite

prerequisite.other: Level 1+ Necromancer & Main Hand Dagger & {@optfeature Necrotic Stab|GW2} used this turn.

entries: {@b Properties:} {@variantrule Chain|GW2|Chain:} {@optfeature Necrotic Slash|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Stab|GW2} -> {@optfeature Necrotic Bite|GW2}
{@b Description:} Strike your foe and gain life force.
{@b Effect:} Make a melee weapon attack against up to two creatures within reach. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage. You gain 6% life force for each target hit.
{@b Scaling:} The damage increases by 1d6 when you reach levels 5 ({@damage 2d6}), 11 ({@damage 3d6}), and 17 ({@damage 4d6}).

optionalfeature.name: A.E.D.
entries: {@b Description:} Activate your A.E.D., enabling the system to heal you after a brief period of time. If you take lethal damage while A.E.D. is active, it ends and heals you for a large amount and removes conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Static Shock
entries: {@b Description:} Use your A.E.D. to stun an enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir H
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Heal, Grants Protection, Regeneration, Swiftness
{@b Description:} Drink Elixir H to heal yourself and gain protection, regeneration, and swiftness.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir H

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir H

entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Grants Protection, Regeneration, Vigor
{@b Description:} Toss Elixir H to grant protection, regeneration, and vigor to allies.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Deploy a turret that heals you briefly, then regenerates you and your allies. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

prerequisite.other: Flip Over Skill for Healing Turret

optionalfeature.name: Regenerating Mist
entries: {@b Description:} Release a mist of healing liquid to regenerate nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Med Kit
entries: {@b Description:} Equip a kit that replaces your weapon with healing skills.

optionalfeature.name: Bandage Self

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Med Kit

entries: {@b Description:} Bandage your wounds and heal yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Bomb Kit
entries: {@b Description:} Equip a kit that replaces your weapon with bomb skills.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Bomb

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Bomb Kit

entries: {@b Description:} Set a timed charge that creates a cloud of smoke, blinding nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Grenade Kit
entries: {@b Description:} Equip a kit that replaces your weapon with grenade skills.

optionalfeature.name: Grenade Barrage

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Grenade Kit

entries: {@b Description:} Throw several grenades at once.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir Gun
entries: {@b Description:} Arm yourself with an elixir gun that replaces your weapon skills.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Mist

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir Gun

entries: {@b Description:} Vent a healing mist, granting regeneration to yourself and allies.

optionalfeature.name: Flamethrower
entries: {@b Description:} Arm yourself with a flamethrower that replaces your weapon skills.

optionalfeature.name: Smoke Vent
entries: {@b Description:} Vent smoke from your flamethrower, blinding nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Tool Kit
entries: {@b Description:} Equip a kit that gives you a variety of tools.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Wrench

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Tool Kit

entries: {@b Description:} Throw a wrench that returns to you, striking foes each way.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir B
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Grants Fury, Might, Resolution, Swiftness
{@b Description:} Drink Elixir B to gain fury, might, resolution, and swiftness, then extend the duration of boons on yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir B

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir B

entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Grants Stability, Fury, Might, Resolution, Retaliation
{@b Description:} Toss Elixir B to grant stability and one of the following boons to allies: fury, might, retaliation, or swiftness.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir C
entries: {@b Description:} Drink Elixir C, converting all conditions into boons, then heal yourself per boon on you.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir C

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir C

entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Converts Conditions, Grants Boons
{@b Description:} Toss Elixir C, converting conditions into boons for allies.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir R
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Endurance Refill, Removes Immobilize
{@b Description:} Drink Elixir R to refill your endurance and remove immobilizing effects.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir R

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir R

entries: {@b Description:} Toss Elixir R to revive allies at a location.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir S
entries: {@b Description:} Drink Elixir S to shrink yourself, recover from stun, and evade attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir S

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir S

entries: {@b Description:} Toss Elixir S, granting stealth to allies in the target area.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir U
entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Grants Quickness, Stability, Vigor
{@b Description:} Drink Elixir U, gaining quickness, stability, and vigor.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir U

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir U

entries: {@b Properties:} Elixir, Breaks Stun, Grants Superspeed
{@b Description:} Toss Elixir U, breaking stuns on allies and granting them superspeed.

optionalfeature.name: Personal Battering Ram
entries: {@b Description:} Launch a target foe with a concealed ram head.

optionalfeature.name: Launch Personal Battering Ram

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Personal Battering Ram

entries: {@b Description:} Shoot a ram's head in front of you, impairing any struck foes.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Boots
entries: {@b Description:} Fly forward, removing movement-impairing conditions and damaging foes with your rocket exhaust. Movement-impairing conditions include cripple, chill, and immobilize.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Kick

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Rocket Boots

entries: {@b Description:} Use your rocket boots to do an explosive kick that burns foes.

optionalfeature.name: Slick Shoes
entries: {@b Description:} Spray oil behind you, knocking down foes. If underwater, foes entering the field are blinded and slowed.

optionalfeature.name: Slick Shoes
entries: {@b Properties:} Gadget, Knockdown, Inflicts Blind, Inflicts Slow
{@b Description:} Spray oil behind you, knocking down foes. If underwater, foes entering the field are blinded and slowed.

optionalfeature.name: Superspeed

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Slick Shoes

entries: {@b Description:} Activate your slick shoes, enabling you to move at superior speeds.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Mine
entries: {@b Description:} Throw out a remote-controlled land mine that damages, knocks back foes, and removes a boon from nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Throw Mine

entries: {@b Description:} Detonate your mine to damage foes and remove a boon from them.

optionalfeature.name: Mine Field
entries: {@b Description:} Plant five mines around yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate Mine Field

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Mine Field

entries: {@b Description:} Detonate your mine field, damaging nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Utility Goggles
entries: {@b Properties:} Gadget, Break Stun, Grants Resistance, Removes Conditions, Inflicts Damage
{@b Description:} Gadget. Break out of stun, gaining resistance, clearing blindness, and removing damaging conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Flashbang

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Utility Goggles

entries: {@b Properties:} Daze, Inflicts Blind, Reveals Stealth
{@b Description:} Throw an explosive at the target area, dazing and blinding enemies on impact. Remove stealth and reveal enemies in a larger area around the impact.

optionalfeature.name: Flame Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Deploy a turret that burns foes. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

optionalfeature.name: Throw Napalm

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Flame Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Throw a ball of napalm that explodes on impact, burning foes around target location.

optionalfeature.name: Net Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Build a net turret that immobilizes nearby foes. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

optionalfeature.name: Net Attack

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Net Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Fire a net from your belt to immobilize your foe.

optionalfeature.name: Rifle Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Build a rifle turret that shoots at foes. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

optionalfeature.name: Surprise Shot

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Rifle Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Fire a bullet out of your belt.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Build a turret that fires rockets. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

optionalfeature.name: Rocket

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Rocket Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Fire a rocket out of your belt that explodes on impact.

optionalfeature.name: Thumper Turret
entries: {@b Description:} Build a high-health thumper turret that damages nearby foes. This turret overcharges when it is first placed.

optionalfeature.name: Rumble

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Thumper Turret

entries: {@b Description:} Release a shock wave of inertial force to damage nearby foes.

optionalfeature.name: Orbital Strike

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elite Mortar Kit

entries: {@b Description:} Call down energy from the sky to blast an area.

optionalfeature.name: Elixir X
entries: {@b Description:} Drink Elixir X to become a rampaging brute, whirling tornado, or powerful lich. Underwater, become either a withering plague or a whirlpool.

optionalfeature.name: Toss Elixir X

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Elixir X

entries: {@b Description:} Toss your Elixir X, transforming enemies at the location into moas.

optionalfeature.name: Supply Crate
entries: {@b Description:} Request a supply drop of turrets. Turrets overcharge when they are first dropped.

optionalfeature.name: Detonate Supply Crate Turrets
entries: {@b Description:} Detonate your supply crate turrets.

optionalfeature.name: Med Pack Drop

prerequisite.other: Tool Belt Skill for Supply Crate

entries: {@b Description:} Call down a supply drop of med packs into a target area.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Entrance
entries: Your first attack when entering combat explodes, dealing damage to nearby foes. This ability refreshes after a dodge roll.

optionalfeature.name: Grenadier
entries: Increase the blast radius of grenades. Using a healing skill casts Lesser Grenade Barrage.

optionalfeature.name: Short Fuse
entries: Gain fury when you hit a foe with an Explosion.

optionalfeature.name: Glass Cannon
entries: Strike damage dealt increases when above health threshold.

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Grenadier|GW2} or {@optfeature Short Fuse|GW2} or {@optfeature Glass Cannon|GW2}

optionalfeature.name: Aim-Assisted Rocket
entries: Missile hits launch a rocket at your target. After enough rockets have been fired, an orbital strike is called instead. This trait has an internal cooldown.

optionalfeature.name: Explosive Temper
entries: Explosions grant stacking ferocity when they hit.

optionalfeature.name: Blast Shield
entries: Explosive Entrance grants barrier. Gain vitality based on a percentage of your power.

optionalfeature.name: Shaped Charge

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Aim-Assisted Rocket|GW2} or {@optfeature Explosive Temper|GW2} or {@optfeature Blast Shield|GW2}

entries: Deal increased strike damage for each stack of vulnerability on your target.

optionalfeature.name: Grand Entrance
entries: Explosive Entrance grants you resistance and increased critical-strike chance for a brief duration.

optionalfeature.name: Shrapnel
entries: Explosions have a chance to cripple and cause bleeding on hit.

optionalfeature.name: Big Boomer
entries: Deal increased strike damage to foes with a lower health percentage than you. Hitting with an Explosion heals you over a few seconds.

optionalfeature.name: Sharpshooter
entries: Critical hits have a chance to cause bleeding.

optionalfeature.name: Chemical Rounds
entries: Gain condition damage. Your pistol skills gain increased condition duration.

optionalfeature.name: Sanguine Array
entries: Gain might when you inflict bleeding on a foe.

optionalfeature.name: High Caliber
entries: You have an increased critical hit chance against foes within the range threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Hematic Focus

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Chemical Rounds|GW2} or {@optfeature Sanguine Array|GW2} or {@optfeature High Caliber|GW2}

entries: Gain fury when you inflict bleeding on an enemy. Fury gives an increased critical-strike chance.

optionalfeature.name: Juggernaut
entries: Gain might while wielding a flamethrower. Might applied to you gains increased duration. Napalm grants you stability and a fire aura.

optionalfeature.name: Thermal Vision
entries: Gain expertise. Increase your outgoing condition damage when you inflict burning.

optionalfeature.name: No Scope
entries: Critical hits on foes within the range threshold have a chance to grant fury. Fury grants you ferocity.

optionalfeature.name: Serrated Steel

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Juggernaut|GW2} or {@optfeature Thermal Vision|GW2} or {@optfeature No Scope|GW2}

entries: Bleeding you inflict gains increased duration.

optionalfeature.name: Equal and Opposite Reaction
entries: Gain quickness and stability when you disable an enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Modified Ammunition
entries: Deal increased strike damage for each condition on a foe.

optionalfeature.name: Incendiary Powder
entries: Burning you inflict lasts longer, and your critical hits inflict burning.

optionalfeature.name: Cleansing Synergy
entries: Using a heal skill triggers a cleansing pulse around you.

optionalfeature.name: Over Shield
entries: Shield skills grant protection to nearby allies. Protection on you gains increased damage reduction.

optionalfeature.name: Automated Medical Response
entries: Grant regeneration to nearby allies when you use a healing skill's associated tool belt skill.

optionalfeature.name: Autodefense Bomb Dispenser
entries: Drop a smoke bomb when you are disabled. Disables include stun, daze, knockdown, pull, knockback, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction Enclosure

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Over Shield|GW2} or {@optfeature Automated Medical Response|GW2} or {@optfeature Autodefense Bomb Dispenser|GW2}

entries: Grant protection to nearby allies when you use a heal skill.

optionalfeature.name: Experimental Turrets
entries: Turrets create a reflective barrier when built and grant boons to allies around them on a regular interval.

optionalfeature.name: Soothing Detonation
entries: Heal nearby allies when using a tool belt skill.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Amplifier

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Experimental Turrets|GW2} or {@optfeature Soothing Detonation|GW2} or {@optfeature Mecha Legs|GW2}

entries: Your power and healing power are increased while you have regeneration.

optionalfeature.name: Anticorrosion Plating
entries: When you grant protection to an ally, cleanse conditions from them.

optionalfeature.name: Bunker Down
entries: Create a proximity mine at your target's location and a med kit at your location when you disable an enemy.

optionalfeature.name: Medical Dispersion Field
entries: While in combat, a percentage of healing you apply to yourself is stored by your Medical Dispersion Field. Each interval, stored healing is spent to heal nearby allies.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Flask
entries: Drink a Lesser Elixir B when struck while below the health threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Invigorating Speed
entries: When you gain swiftness or superspeed, you also gain vigor.

optionalfeature.name: Protection Injection
entries: Gain protection when you are disabled. Disables include stun, daze, knockdown, pull, knockback, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Health Insurance
entries: Increase your incoming healing effectiveness. Gain increased healing to others while using a med kit.

optionalfeature.name: Transmute

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Invigorating Speed|GW2} or {@optfeature Protection Injection|GW2} or {@optfeature Health Insurance|GW2}

entries: Drink a Lesser Elixir C when you use a healing skill.

optionalfeature.name: Comeback Cure
entries: Grant regeneration when you remove a condition from an ally.

optionalfeature.name: Boiling Point
entries: Gain fury when you gain might at or above the threshold.

optionalfeature.name: Backpack Regenerator
entries: Recover health every second when using an Engineering Kit.

optionalfeature.name: Compounding Chemicals

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Comeback Cure|GW2} or {@optfeature Boiling Point|GW2} or {@optfeature Backpack Regenerator|GW2}

entries: Heal yourself when you grant yourself a boon. Remove a condition from yourself when you use an elixir skill. Gain increased concentration.

optionalfeature.name: HGH
entries: Elixirs gain increased durations, and grant might.

optionalfeature.name: Purity of Purpose
entries: When you would cleanse a condition from an ally, convert it into a boon instead. This can affect multiple targets simultaneously.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Reactivity
entries: Gain barrier when you successfully finish a combo field with a leap or a blast. Every third successful finish grants a larger barrier and might.

optionalfeature.name: Optimized Activation
entries: Using tool belt skills grants vigor.

optionalfeature.name: Static Discharge
entries: Discharge a bolt of lightning whenever you use a tool belt skill.

optionalfeature.name: Reactive Lenses
entries: Activate Lesser Utility Goggles when using a healing skill.

optionalfeature.name: Power Wrench
entries: Reduce the recharge of your elite skill when you dodge.

optionalfeature.name: Mechanized Deployment

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Static Discharge|GW2} or {@optfeature Reactive Lenses|GW2} or {@optfeature Power Wrench|GW2}

entries: Your tool belt skills gain reduced recharge. Tool belt skills remove conditions. Engage Photon Forge cannot activate this trait.

optionalfeature.name: Streamlined Kits
entries: Equipping an Engineering Kit creates an attack or spell and grants you swiftness.

optionalfeature.name: Lock On
entries: Striking a stealthed foe triggers Invisible Analysis. Disabling a foe triggers Controlled Analysis. Disables include stun, daze, knockdown, pull, knockback, sink, float, launch, taunt, and fear.

optionalfeature.name: Takedown Round
entries: Deal increased strike damage while your endurance is not full.

optionalfeature.name: Excessive Energy

prerequisite.other: {@optfeature Streamlined Kits|GW2} or {@optfeature Lock On|GW2} or {@optfeature Takedown Round|GW2}

entries: Strike damage dealt is increased while you have vigor.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Battery
entries: Gain Kinetic Charges when you use a tool belt skill. At maximum, charges gain a burst of speed.
